current_fears: Worry about falling behind in journalism coursework while learning coding
Concern that lacking coding skills would make her uncompetitive in journalism job market
current_challenges: Anxiety about initiating conversations in study groups
Struggling to balance coding practice with journalism workload

Consistently attended study group despite anxiety

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: (1) Anxiety about balancing coding practice with journalism coursework, (2) Fear of job market competitiveness without coding skills, (3) Social anxiety in academic settings. Solutions offered/accepted: (1) Start with manageable HTML practice using blog backups (accepted), (2) Schedule short coding sessions after morning coffee (implemented), (3) Breathing exercises before class (tried successfully), (4) Initiate low-stakes peer conversations (implemented). Student's response: Implemented all solutions - scheduled practice, modified blog, attended study group, used breathing techniques, and completed tutorial. Evidence of progress: (1) Organized peer workshop after initiating HTML discussion, (2) Raised hand in class and sat closer to front, (3) Completed coding tutorial with positive attitude, (4) Scheduled social meetup, (5) Reported reduced panic and increased self-efficacy.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Anxiety about coding workshops due to skill gap fears, 2) Balancing journalism workload with new skill development, 3) Job market competitiveness concerns. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Start with HTML basics for journalism applications, 2) Schedule short coding sessions using calendar blocking, 3) Reframe coding as supplemental skill. Student's response: Implemented calendar blocking, initiated HTML discussion at study group leading to workshop planning, practiced breathing exercises before class. Evidence of progress: Sat in second row at study group, raised hand in Zoom class after breathing exercise, completed coding tutorial, formed peer learning group.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Anxiety about coding workshops, falling behind in journalism work, job market competitiveness, and social/class participation anxiety. Solutions offered/accepted: Starting with HTML blog experiments, time-blocked practice sessions, 4-4-4 breathing technique, blog backups, and small participation goals. Student's response: Implemented calendar blocking, tried breathing before class (raised hand), completed beginner tutorial, initiated peer workshop planning, and moved closer to front in study group. Evidence of improvement: Reduced coding intimidation, increased class participation, social initiative with peers, and expressed growing confidence in small steps.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Social anxiety in academic settings (entering workshops, class participation), 2) Fear of job market competitiveness without coding skills, 3) Balancing coding practice with journalism studies. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) 4-4-4 breathing technique before interactions, 2) Starting coding with HTML basics using beginner-friendly resources, 3) Reframing coding as supplemental skill, 4) Creating blog backups for safe experimentation. Student's response: Implemented breathing technique before class (resulting in participation), scheduled coding practice sessions, initiated peer collaboration for workshop, completed tutorial while finding enjoyment. Evidence of progress: Sat closer to front in study group, received professor acknowledgment after participation, formed peer learning group, expressed reduced fear and increased self-trust.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed: 1) Anxiety about coding workshops/job competitiveness, 2) Social anxiety in academic settings, 3) Balancing skill development with coursework. Solutions: Breathing techniques, HTML-focused learning, micro-participation goals, and cat-themed tutorials. Response: Casey implemented breathing before class (raised hand successfully), initiated peer collaboration (workshop planning), sat closer in groups, and completed first coding tutorial. Progress: Reduced avoidance behaviors, increased academic participation, formed learning community, and reported feeling 'less scared' with tangible skill-building wins.
